content: the needle rt right twist keeping your needles at the front of these socks are knitted on 2 5mm needles not 3 25mm your work insert your right hand needle into the second as stated on the ball band this will produce a different stitch on the left hand needle knitwise and knit the gauge but will ensure a firmer more hard-wearing stitch but don t take the stitch off the needle now knit fabric for your socks the ideal gauge for these socks is into the first stitch on the left hand needle in the usual 30 stitches to 10cm 4ins so use whatever size needles way and slide both stitches off your needle are required to reach that gauge and do check that your knitted fabric is firm but not stiff it is often easier to cast on using dpns before changing caring for your socks to the short circular needle if you want to use magic loop you will be able to cast on with the larger circular needle if you prefer to do so but remember not to pull your cast on stitches too tight if you use dpns you reshape whilst damp might find it easiest to cast on and work 2 row before dry flat do not tumble dry dividing the stitches across the needles when working from a chart you will read all rounds from right to left 1 socks both alike 68 sts next round p1 k2 p2 ktbl 4 times p2 ktbl p3 ktbl using vintage tinsel cast on 60 64 68 72 sts using 4 times p3 ktbl p2 ktbl 4 times p2 k2 p1 twice 3 0mm dpns the pattern has been written for a cast on with straight needles if you wish to join into the round 72 sts straight away work row 1 twice and omit row 2 next round k1 p1 k2 p2 ktbl 4 times p2 ktbl p3 work rib as follows ktbl 4 times p3 ktbl p2 ktbl 4 times p2 k2 p1 k1 twice 60 sts row 1 k1 p2 ktbl 3 times p1 ktbl twice 3 times for all sizes p1 ktbl p2 3 times k1 twice 60 sts using either the chart or the written instructions and row 2 work all knit and purl stitches as they present starting at round 1 continue to work each round in themselves working ptbl into the ktbl of previous
